alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Chariton; Cooper; Howard; Pettis; Randolph; Saline (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:22AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, southern Chariton, Pettis, central Carroll, Howard, Saline and Cooper Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 922 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Keytesville to 10 miles northwest of Laurie. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sedalia, Marshall, Boonville, Carrollton, Windsor, Fayette, Slater, Sweet Springs, Glasgow, La Monte, New Franklin, Brunswick, Pilot Grove, Smithton, Green Ridge, Otterville, Bunceton, Bosworth, Armstrong and Malta Bend. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 63 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for central and west central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Chariton; Cooper; Howard; Pettis; Randolph; Saline
